SEARCH
Package system

Class MedicationTrackingSystem

java.lang.Object
system.MedicationTrackingSystem
public class MedicationTrackingSystem extends Object
The MedicationTrackingSystem class manages patients, doctors, medications, and prescriptions. It provides functionalities such as adding, searching, editing, and removing records, processing prescriptions, generating reports, and handling medication stock management.

    • removePatient

      public void removePatient(String patientID)
      Removes a patient from the system by ID using a regular loop. It iterates over the list, checks each patient's ID, and removes the matching one.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The ID of the patient to be removed.

    • removeDoctor

      public void removeDoctor(String doctorID)
      Removes a doctor from the system by ID.
      Parameters:
      doctorID - The ID of the doctor to be removed.

    • removeMedication

      public void removeMedication(String medicationID)
      Removes a medication from the pharmacy by ID.
      Parameters:
      medicationID - The ID of the medication to be removed.

    • editPatient

      public void editPatient(String patientID, String newName, int newAge, String newPhone)
      Edits a patient's details in the system using a regular `for` loop.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The ID of the patient to be edited.
      newName - The new name for the patient.
      newAge - The new age of the patient.
      newPhone - The new contact number for the patient.

    • editDoctor

      public void editDoctor(String doctorID, String newName, int newAge, String newPhone, String newSpecialization)
      Edits a doctor's details in the system using a `foreach` loop.
      Parameters:
      doctorID - The ID of the doctor to be edited.
      newName - The new name for the doctor.
      newAge - The new age of the doctor.
      newPhone - The new contact number for the doctor.
      newSpecialization - The new specialization of the doctor.

    • editMedication

      public void editMedication(String medicationID, String newName, String newDose, int newStock)
      Edits a medication's details in the system using a `foreach` loop.
      Parameters:
      medicationID - The ID of the medication to be edited.
      newName - The new name for the medication.
      newDose - The new dosage for the medication.
      newStock - The new stock quantity for the medication.

    • searchPatient

      public Patient searchPatient(String name)
      Searches for a patient by name using a regular `for` loop. It performs a case-insensitive search and returns the first match.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the patient to search for.
      Returns:
      The matching Patient object, or null if not found.

    • searchDoctor

      public Doctor searchDoctor(String name)
      Searches for a doctor by name using a `foreach` loop. It performs a case-insensitive search and returns the first match.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the doctor to search for.
      Returns:
      The matching Doctor object, or null if not found.

    • searchMedication

      public Medication searchMedication(String name)
      Searches for a medication by name using a `foreach` loop. It performs a case-insensitive search and returns the first match.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the medication to search for.
      Returns:
      The matching Medication object, or null if not found.

    • acceptPrescription

      public void acceptPrescription(String prescID, String doctorName, String patientName, String medName, LocalDate prescDate)
      Accepts a new prescription and links it to the corresponding doctor, patient, and medication. Ensures that all required entities exist before proceeding.
      Parameters:
      prescID - The unique prescription ID.
      doctorName - The name of the prescribing doctor.
      patientName - The name of the patient receiving the prescription.
      medName - The name of the prescribed medication.
      prescDate - The issuance date of the prescription.

    • assignPatientToDoctor

      public void assignPatientToDoctor(String patientName, String doctorName)
      Assigns a patient to a doctor's list. Ensures that both the doctor and patient exist before assigning.
      Parameters:
      patientName - The name of the patient to be assigned.
      doctorName - The name of the doctor to whom the patient will be assigned.

    • generateReport

      public void generateReport()
      Generates a comprehensive system report including: - A list of all patients - A list of all doctors with their specializations - A list of all medications with stock and expiry details If any section is empty, a message is displayed.

    • checkForExpiredMedications

      public void checkForExpiredMedications()
      Checks for expired medications in the system. - Iterates through the medication list and identifies expired drugs. - Displays the expiration status in a structured format. - Alerts if expired medications are found.

    • printPrescriptionsByDoctor

      public void printPrescriptionsByDoctor(String doctorName)
      Prints all prescriptions issued by a specific doctor. - Searches for the doctor by name. - Iterates through all patients to find prescriptions linked to the doctor. - Displays prescription details in a structured format.
      Parameters:
      doctorName - The name of the doctor whose prescriptions need to be displayed.

    • printPrescriptionsByPatient

      public void printPrescriptionsByPatient(String patientName)
      Prints all prescriptions assigned to a specific patient. - Searches for the patient by name. - Retrieves and displays all prescriptions linked to the patient. - Provides structured output with prescription details.
      Parameters:
      patientName - The name of the patient whose prescriptions need to be displayed.

    • restockAllMedications

      public void restockAllMedications(Scanner scanner)
      Restocks all medications in the pharmacy. - The user can choose to restock by a random amount (5-20) or enter a specific amount. - If no medications exist, an error message is displayed. - Provides a structured report after restocking.
      Parameters:
      scanner - A shared Scanner object from MainMenu to avoid closing issues.
